name: hemlock
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
[ U ] a type of poison made from a plant: Socrates was made to drink hemlock after being condemned for corrupting the youth of Athens.
[ C or U ] a plant with small white flowers and divided leaves from which the poison hemlock comes: Beware, because this plant looks very similar to poisonous hemlock.water hemlock Water hemlock is among Europe and North America's most toxic plants.
ioanna_alexa/iStock/Getty Images Plus/GettyImages
[ C ] (also hemlock fir, hemlock spruce) an evergreen tree (= one that never loses its leaves) that grows in North America, used for its wood: The hiking trail winds past towering hemlocks and oaks. the hemlock forests of North America
More examplesFewer examplesHerbal preparations involving the poisons hemlock or arsenic were relatively common in ancient medicine. An extreme toxin such as hemlock or cyanide would have caused writhing and contortions.The hemlocks, spruces and cedars that spread over southeast Alaska seem to go on forever.From the trail, you can explore in any direction among mountain laurels, large hemlocks, and ferns.
